definition: temple fair
temple/ancestral shrine/CL:座[zuo4]/temple fair/great imperial hall/imperial
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Now it is the main site of the yearly temple fair.
sentences.chinese: 磁器口每年一次的庙会也以此为主会场。

sentences.english: So, this is the temple fair, right?
sentences.chinese: 那么，这就是庙会了，对吧？

sentences.english: It is common for people in Beijing to go to the temple fairs during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在北京，人们常会在春节期间逛庙会。

sentences.english: Yeah, I'm going to the Temple Fair with my family. ?
sentences.chinese: 我打算和全家一起去逛庙会。

sentences.english: A:Yeah,I'm going to the Temple Fair with my family.
sentences.chinese: 我打算和全家一起去逛庙会。

sentences.english: Carl and Emil went up to the Catholic fair.
sentences.chinese: 卡尔和爱弥儿去赶天主教庙会了。

sentences.english: Although temple fairs are held in different places, their basic contents are similar.
sentences.chinese: 尽管庙会在不同地方举办，但其基本内容是相似的。

sentences.english: Although different places hold their temple fair at various dates, the contents are similar.
sentences.chinese: 虽然各地举办庙会的时间不同，但基本内容都差不多。

sentences.english: I also heard today is the last day for the street fair.
sentences.chinese: 我还听说过今天是庙会的最后一天呢。

sentences.english: Everyday Chinese Strolling Around a Fair or Going Skating?
sentences.chinese: 生活汉语逛庙会还是去滑冰？

sentences.english: The Temple Fair is busy and crowded today.
sentences.chinese: 庙会上人们比肩继踵，真是热闹啊。

sentences.english: Hou Dewen ready to start the project, in fact, the culture street of temple fair.
sentences.chinese: 侯德文准备启动的项目，其实就是文化街的庙会活动。

sentences.english: Now, Beijing holds temple fair every Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 现在，北京市每年春节都举办庙会。

sentences.english: Many in Beijing have been visiting temple fairs to celebrate the arrival of the Year of the Horse.
sentences.chinese: 许多北京市民都参加庙会，以迎接马年来临。

sentences.english: The lantern was bought when I was visiting a temple fair.
sentences.chinese: 灯笼是在赶庙会的时候买的。

sentences.english: I'm going to the Temple Fair with my family.
sentences.chinese: 我打算和全家一起去逛庙会。

definition: festival entertainment (lion dance, dragon lantern etc)
to burn incense at a temple
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
temple of Goddess of Fertility
to go to market/to go to a fair
the Lantern Festival (15th of first month of lunar calendar)
market/bazaar/fair
carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
folk festival, esp. involving shrine or image of God
to perform a lion dance
Lantern Festival/night of the 15th of the first lunar month/see also 元夜[yuan2 ye4]/sticky rice dumplings
popular custom
Yangge, a popular rural folk dance
to burn incense
Buddhist pilgrim/Buddhist worshipper
dragon dance
